about_the_game:
Support the development and refresh your desktop with these Nevrosa style pictures made exclusively for you to say thank you. That's you who help us stay in game!

Thank you for supporting Nevrosa! This means a lot for us and inspires to work even harder than we do to bring you new Nevrosa games.

You really help.

List of supported resolutions:

  • 2560x1440
  • 2560x1080
  • 1920x1080

DLC files can be found inside the game folder — go to Spider Song/Wallpapers.

At noon, we were shooting the gun when the phone rang.
William's eyes lit up as soon as he knew the order had been completed and was on its way to us.

A car drove up to the house, and Morris (the guy who had put the fence so nicely last summer) started installing a crane:

— It's huge, it can get inside, only through a window.

I opened the windows in the hall on the first floor.
It moved slowly through the air until it was in the semi-darkness of the mansion.

Sir William took a large knife and began to carefully remove the protection with my help.

My hands were shaking in anticipation that something incredible was about to happen. William's enthusiasm literally electrified the air.

I hardly recognized that giant mirror from the shop. All of its massive surface is now covered with black non-reflective material, rich frame was removed and replaced with metal fittings.

Sir William looked pleased.

The Butler's Diary, 1965.
